website_summaries.verdict: The unusual material of these cooling cloths stay cool and wet, but dry to the touch.
pros: Gets cool when it's wet, but does not transfer wetness
Comes with a plastic storage case
Also provides a layer of sun protection
Very effective at keeping you cooler in very hot weather
cons: At 33", this towel is a little bit shorter than others on the market
It also dries hard instead of soft

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for a trip to DisneyWorld. At first I thought they would be useless and just really come in handy. Boy was I wrong! First off a little side trick. We would get them wet wring them out and get ice and let the ice sit with them (slightly damp) (I know people say not to get them cold) in a sink until the next morning. They stayed ICE cold the entire day in 102dg temps with 95% humidity. At one point our 4 year old said it was to cold but we LOVED them and will be using them again when it gets hot.
customer_reviews.author: RyG

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids in the summer
customer_reviews.text: Took our towel to the zoo today in 110 degree heat. My 14 month old sat on the towel in his stroller and it was such a good size it covered the whole seat. We also had a fan blowing on him to help circulate that cool air, and it made the miserably hot day bearable. Summer fun requires these for little ones who can't regulate their internal temperature as well as adults. Glad I have it and I'll recommend to all my mommy friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Best pre vacation purchase I have made!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the smartest purchase for our vacation to Sea World San Antonio! It was SO hot, but I purchased these for the whole family. It truly spared us from just pure heat exhaustion, not to mention kept our shoulders and necks protected from the sun. We applied plenty of sun screen, but the added protection was nice. I recommend these for ANY amusement park in the summer in Texas!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michaelsluckygirl13

customer_reviews.title: Hard as a rock when dried
customer_reviews.text: Wonder why no one has mentioned how stiff these things are when they dry? All fine and good (albeit strangely alien in texture...this is not a "towel" or "cloth") when wet, but if you lay flat to dry - because who wants mold - they come out like lavash. I love the idea, and very useful in hot climes, but if you can't constantly keep it wet...cracker time!
customer_reviews.author: Mgmt NinjaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Color runs out of towels, avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the blue and yellow set and fortunately found out that the blue one bleeds color before I went to use it. Sure enough, when wringing it out in the sink you can see that the water being squeezed out has blue tint to it! Absolutely terrible.

customer_reviews.text: Have tried several times and it provides absolutely no chilling effect whatsoever. It simply is moist and remains at the ambient air temperature. I would not recommend this item.

product_meta.title: Frogg Toggs Chilly Pad Cooling Towel,One Size,Lime & Dark Blue by Frogg Toggs
product_meta.description: Frogg Togg Chilly Pad is an innovative way to keep cool during a workout, hard ride, tough climb or any other strenuous activity. When wet, the towel becomes considerably cooler than the outside air, thereby providing cooling relief to the user. When it stops cooling, simply re-wet the towel and wring it out. Machine washable.
feature_bullets: 2 Pack of the Best type of Chilly Pad
Made from a hyper-evaporative material that retains water while remaining dry to the touch
The Chilly Pad is an innovative way to cool down while enduring outdoor heat and/or high levels of physical activity
When it stops cooling, simply re-wet the towel in hot or cold water and wring it out. Within minutes, it's cool again
